question:
Consider the following statements with respect to the UNDP Human Development Index-2018?
  1. HDI is measured in three basic dimensions viz. health, education and standard of living
  2. India has been placed in the Medium Human Development category in the recent index
Which of the above is / are correct statements?
explanation:
The HDI is measured in three basic dimensions of human development for assessing long-term progress: health as measured by life expectancy at birth, knowledge measured by mean years of education, and standard of living measured by per capita gross national income. Norway ranked first in 2018 Human Development Index while India ranked 130. India’s HDI value is 0.640, which put India in the Low human development category.  Some Key facts related to India in 2018 HDI are:
  • In Gender Inequality Index India ranked at 127
  • Women hold only 11.6 per cent of parliamentary seats
  • 39 per cent of adult women have reached at least a secondary level of education as compared to 64 per cent males
  • Female participation in the labour market is 27.2 per cent compared to 78.8 for men
  • Gross National Income (GNI) per capita increased 26.6 per cent between 1990 and 2017.
